CDISC Notes: Unique identifier for a study.
Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all
applications or submissions involving the product.

Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records
within a domain. May be any valid number.
Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
Internal or external healthcare encounter identifier.

Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor’s operational database.
Example: Line number on a Healthcare encounters page.

Variable Label:
Reported Term for the
Healthcare Encounter
CDISC Notes: Verbatim or preprinted CRF term for the healthcare encounter.

Variable Label: Dictionary-Derived Term for the Healthcare Encounter
CDISC Notes: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY).
Used to define a category of topic-related values.
A further categorization of HOCAT values.

A value of “Y” indicates that this healthcare encounter event was pre- specified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported
events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms)

Used when the occurrence of specific healthcare encounters is solicited to indicate whether or not an encounter occurred. Values are
null for spontaneously reported events.
The status indicates that the pre-specified question was not answered.
Describes the reason data for a pre-specified event was not collected. Used in conjunction with HOSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
Collection date and time of the healthcare encounter.
Start date/time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of admission).
End date/time of the healthcare encounter (date of discharge).

Study day of event collection relative to the sponsor-defined
RFSTDTC.

Variable Label:
Study Day of Start of
Healthcare Encounter
CDISC Notes:
Study day of the start of the healthcare encounter relative to the
sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

Variable Label: Study Day of End of Healthcare Encounter
CDISC Notes: Study day of the end of the healthcare encounter relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

Collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from the start and end date/times.
Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

Variable Label:
Start Relative to Reference
Time Point
CDISC Notes:
Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the
sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.

Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor- defined reference point referred to by STRTPT. Examples: “2003-12-
15” or “VISIT 1”.

Variable Label:
End Relative to Reference
Time Point
CDISC Notes:
Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference
time point defined by variable HOENTPT.

Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by HOENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT
2".
